The source of the claim: The expert's verdict mentions that the claim originated from a tweet by the Twitter handle 'Santani Kids' and was accompanied by an image of an alleged newspaper extract. This aspect verifies the source of the claim.
Multiple instances of circulation: The expert's verdict highlights that the claim has been circulating on social media and WhatsApp for several years. It mentions specific instances where the claim was shared by different individuals and groups. This aspect verifies the widespread circulation of the claim.
Analysis of the image: The expert's verdict provides a detailed analysis of the image accompanying the claim. It points out discrepancies in the language used and identifies the presence of a photoshopped element, which is the flag of Hezbollah. This aspect verifies the manipulation of the image.
Previous instances of circulation: The expert's verdict mentions that the claim had been circulated by various fake news sites and even featured in Saamana, the mouthpiece of the Shiv Sena. This aspect verifies that the claim has been previously shared and discussed in different platforms.
